alert.note: Alert for Kent; Providence (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 10 at 2:26PM EDT until September 10 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR CENTRAL KENT AND CENTRAL PROVIDENCE COUNTIES... At 226 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The flooding has resulted in multiple water rescues and road closures in and around Providence. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area, with additional flash flooding expected. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Providence, Warwick, Cranston, Pawtucket, East Providence, Coventry, Cumberland, North Providence, West Warwick, Johnston, Smithfield, Lincoln, Central Falls, Burrillville, East Greenwich, North Smithfield, Scituate, Glocester, West Greenwich and Foster. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 2 HOURS
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
